questions.prompt: Which of the following is the correct way to initialize a new Git repository?
Which git command do you use to upload local repository content to a remote repository?

correct.text: git add . will work but the request was just for a single file.

questions.prompt: Which command would you use to stage a single file called called my_awesome_script.py so we can commit it?
How you create a new commit with the message "Bugfix #1"?
Which command will allow you create a branch called feature/bugfix and switch to that branch at the same time?
After you install Git and prior to issuing the first commit, which two configuration properties does the tool expect to be configured?
Which command is not used to determine what branch you are on?
You made an unneccessary change to oops.py in your working directory. What command would discard the uncommitted changes to oops.py?
Which command will download https://github.com/user1/awesome_repo.git to your local computer?
Which command will incorporate changes from a remote repository into the current branch?

answers: Best way is just use explorer to move readme.MD to another directory, do a commit, and then move the file back.

correct.text: git rm -f will delete the file from the staging area and the disk. git rm --cached keeps the file on teh disk but removes from staging.

questions.prompt: You have done git add readme.MD. You would like to remove the file from the staging area but still keep it on disk. Which command do you use?
Which command will compare bugfix1 and bugfix2?
